Name: Welcome to the Fan Club
Description: You meet an enthusiastic student named Bjarki. Thanks to his recommendations, you find yourself intrigued by all the different "fan clubs" across the Academy…
QuestDesc: You meet an enthusiastic student named Bjarki. Thanks to his recommendations, you find yourself intrigued by all the different "fan clubs" across the Academy…

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, you look familiar... Wait, I remember! You're the new student!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's life been so far at the Academy?

Options.PlotLineKey: The food is unappetizing, but everything else is fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's great to hear. We here at the Spacetrek Collective come from all over Solaris. Everyone has different customs and habits, and it can take a minute to get used to everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh, that's a fair point. The taste and texture of the Institute's food... leaves something to be desired.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the nutritional balance is scientifically optimized. It becomes an acquired taste once you get used to it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of campus life, {PlayerName}, have you had a chance to check out any of the Academy's fan clubs?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're looking for a fun way to spend your free time, joining one is a great idea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's great, then I'll spare you the introductions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let me give you the quick rundown! While official clubs get research funding from the Academy, "fan clubs" are student-run groups for people with similar interests.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's no pressure to have a research topic. It's just people hanging out and doing what they love.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fan clubs... Let me see. Aha, here it is!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I highly recommend this article, "Freshman Essential: Startorch's Top Fan Club Picks"! Hang on a sec...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bjarki forwards the article to your Terminal. You quickly skim it, and several fan clubs immediately catch your eye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The article lists the most popular fan clubs in Startorch Academy, and their usual hangout spots.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If any of them have caught your eye, be sure to check them out, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The article says there's a Peaks of Prestige fan club...? Could I have been a former member? Might be worth checking out.)

Options.PlotLineKey: Thanks, I'll go when I have time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great. Don't forget to let me know what you think of the article's recommendations!

Dialogues.Speaker: Anita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you've come at the right moment. Have you seen Olof?

Dialogues.Speaker: Anita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strange... He hasn't been coming to club meetings at all lately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's the one who lost that duel to Miss Chessa, back when Professor Calith tried to shut us down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After that duel, he just stopped joining any activities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Olof was always so proud of his skills. I think losing to Chessa might have crushed his spirit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, could you go look for him? I don't think he's in the mood to see me or anyone else from the fan club.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But he might talk to you. You're the one who beat Chessa. In his eyes, you basically avenged him.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you know where he went?
Any clue as to his whereabouts?

Dialogues.Speaker: Anita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me think... Ah, I hear he hangs out in the arcade after class.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you find him, please ask him what's on his mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether he needs our help, just needs some space, or... is even thinking of leaving the club, we'll support him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, it's you... Well, at least you're not someone from the club here to rub it in. Hah.

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you wouldn't do that. You're the force of nature who bested Professor Calith and saved the fan club.

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must seem like a complete ant to you, don't I?

Options.PlotLineKey: The whole point of dueling is to have fun.

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course you'd say that... you won. Winners get to be gracious. Winners also get to hand out dismissive platitudes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But what about the loser? What do I get?

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's funny. I once thought I was the second-best duelist in the fan club, and by extension, the Academy. But since dueling Miss Chessa, I've realized...

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All my hard work, my so-called "talent," every win I was so proud of... it was all nothing next to a real genius. So what's the point?

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't feel the slightest bit of joy in dueling now. And I refuse to become a pathetic bully who only picks on weaklings to feel better.

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell me, {PlayerName}, what should I do?

Options.PlotLineKey: If that's the way things are...

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is... Is that your answer? Did you not hear a word I just said?

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I cannot find satisfaction in dueling anymore. Victory has abandoned me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fine. I mean, you are the one who defeated Miss Chessa. Maybe our duel will be different than how I'm imagining it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Olof
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll wager the last of my passion on this showdown. Let the duel begin!

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Correct! And I'm the Argus Workshop's leader, Garris.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Interested in our fan club?

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Simply put, we "craft weapons." More precisely, Broadblades, Swords... that whole classic arsenal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, unlike the smithies of Septimont with their furnaces and anvils, we craft weapons by using a Crafting Bay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We encourage everyone to add their own personal flair to the weapon templates. It's how we pay respect to tradition, using the tools of today.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why do you make weapons but not other craftwork?

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I think, on some level, we're all hardwired to appreciate weapons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We humans discovered fire to protect ourselves from the dark. But simply huddling by the flames wasn't enough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To conquer what lurked in the shadows, we had to invent the blade. It was the key that let us venture into the unknown.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So for us, the furnace's fire is our craft, and the weapon is our courage to venture into the unknown.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, that's the version we put on the club's homepage. The truth is… everyone here just really likes sharp, shiny, melee weapons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is a blade if not humanity's romance of the ages? Who wouldn't want a legendary weapon and a work of art crafted by their own hand?

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How 'bout it? Want to join our fan club?

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excellent! Then let's get you started. First, craft a Sword.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, take this Luxite. If you run out, you can always collect more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh ho! You've crafted quite a piece there... Mind if I take a look?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Garris takes your crafted weapon, swings it a few times, examines it carefully, and then hands it back to you with clear respect.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Wow, not bad at all! The balance and grip are excellent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not sharpened yet, but the quality of the metal is superb. I can tell it'll hold an incredible edge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The length and weight distribution differ significantly from the crafting templates. Did you modify it to fit your combat style and personal habits...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Oh! I'm sorry, I'm getting carried away. It's not every day I come across a masterpiece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing compares to the feel of a weapon you've crafted yourself, right? A store-bought blade could never match that.

Options.PlotLineKey: My friend gifted me an excellent sword.
Right. After all, you know your own needs best.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I've heard that swordsmen in Huanglong value "simplicity above all." At the end of the day, a weapon is just an extension of one's own skill.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the hands of a true master, even the most basic blade can defeat a formidable foe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You show Garris the "Bloodpact's Pledge" that you received from Cantarella.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is... is that what I think it is?! The legendary, secret craftsmanship of the Fisalia family in Ragunna?

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've only ever read about it. To see it in person... Ah, the blade is sharper than I ever imagined! There's an entire storm in this blade!

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, well said! A weapon you craft yourself becomes like a part of your own body.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that, my friend, is the true romance of the craft.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for showing me your exceptional crafting skills, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Garris
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're welcome to practice crafting at the Argus Workshop anytime. After all, even the finest smiths never stop honing their art, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Umph... Urgh....

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hello, do you know where I can find the Gastro-Alchemist fan club?

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh, "Gastro-Alchemist"...? That's me.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you the fan club's leader?

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nope, the leader is in the infirmary. Sudden stomachache.

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, Dr. Luuk seems to cook for himself a lot... Maybe we should recruit him too...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, you're not exactly wrong. Normally... everyone just goes to the cafeteria to eat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahh, I forgot to introduce myself. My name is Felicia, and I'm a member of the Gastro-Alchemist Fan Club.

Options.PlotLineKey: What does your fan club actually do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, the grand mission was to "improve Academy food," but unlike those real clubs, our fan club doesn't do food engineering or nutrition research.

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're all about the methods! Little life hacks for combining the food you can buy on campus to make it taste better.

Options.PlotLineKey: There's a way to make it taste better?

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For example, one of our recipes calls for taking out the fried noodle stuffing in "Why-Not" buns, filling the cavity with Squeezy Jelly, then soaking the whole thing in leftover broth from a Midnight Wonder Cup Noodle...

Options.PlotLineKey: That sounds like an unholy mess!
That sounds like a trip to the pit of despair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's one of our tamer recipes. In this fan club, everyone experiments liberally, combining whatever ingredients they have on hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We record the tastier combinations. But even if something tastes weird or turns out to be a failure, we still eat it. We have a strict no-waste policy!

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every member is mentally prepared for any, ahem, gastrointestinal outcome. In fact, our club leader is in the infirmary precisely because of her latest creation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, want to give our food a try? I just came up with a recipe that should taste pretty good.

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good! It's been too long since a new student showed such admirable courage and curiosity!

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Allow me to get ready...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Felicia brings out a plate of something unidentifiable. You don't dare ask what it is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With trepidation, fear... and a tiny spark of anticipation you'd never admit to, you muster up the courage to take a bite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well...? How is it?

Options.PlotLineKey: It's strange but not entirely unpleasant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew! Wonderful! I'll go ahead and add this to the Gastro-Alchemist cookbook!

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll even name the recipe after you: {PlayerName}'s Special Nutri-Meal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks for your help, {PlayerName}! I'll whip up something even more exciting next time!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't have the courage to try the new dish. Felicia understands your apprehension, though she's a little disappointed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww.. such a pity. What if it was actually delicious?

Dialogues.Speaker: Felicia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, more for me, I guess... Let's just hope I don't end up keeping our club leader company in the infirmary.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Good. Now that's sorted. I can go check out the other fan clubs.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (There are other fan clubs mentioned in the article. I'll check them out, too.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Well ... I've visited all of the fan clubs listed in the article.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Might as well go find Bjarki.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about it, {PlayerName}? Were those fan clubs worth checking out?

Options.PlotLineKey: They weren't what I had imagined.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, that's great. Guess I didn't write my article in vain...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I oversold it, huh? Did they not live up to the hype? I guess I should go back and make some edits...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why, yes. I like to post a few recommendation guides on the school forum to help new students find their footing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether it's fan clubs or campus urban legends… this Academy is just full of interesting things to discover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think it would be such a shame if no one knew of their existence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, that reminds me! At the end of the term, the school holds a huge festival. All the official clubs show off their work, and the fan clubs put together their own exhibits too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can't miss it, {PlayerName}! Not when the Academy will be especially lively!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bjarki
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright then… see you next time, {PlayerName}! I hope you have a wonderful and unforgettable time at the Academy!
